result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald A Black was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronald A Black is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ronald A Black was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on September 21, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
for permission to withdraw as counsel, filed by Atty Schulenburg; No action to be taken by court, 11-2-16

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Eric Schulenburg.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ronald A Black in court with attorney Eric Schulenburg. Prosecuting Atty Rachel E Sattler appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant was going to plea but then decided not to.  Ct. will reschedule case to allow time for Atty Schulenburg to meet with client.
from Atty Schulenburg to be excused from/to reschedule status conference on 5-26- Request granted
AMENDED - Atty. Eric Schulenburg appointed 4/6/16
Status conference on May 26, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney David J.W. Klauser.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ronald A Black in court with attorney David J.W. Klauser. Prosecuting Atty Rachel E Sattler appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ronald A Black in court with attorney David J.W. Klauser. RE: Dr. Brad Smith's report regarding competency.  Defendant agrees with Dr. Smith's report. ADA Sattler does not challenge Dr. Smith's report.  Ct accepts report and finds Mr. Black is competent to proceed.  
Defendant requests to proceed pro-se.  Ct. has colloquy with defendant about representing himself. ADA Sattler makes argument for an attorney to remain on the case. Ct. finds that there is not evidence that defendant is competent to represent himself.  Ct. denies defendant's request to proceed pro-se.  Ct. orders Atty Klauser to continue on case. Ct. conducts Ludwig hearing with defendant.  Ct. adjourns for a time for attorney Klauser to talk to Mr. Black.  Ct. reconvenes and Atty Klauser indicates that defendant is requesting new counsel and a jury trial.  Ct. orders new attorney to be appointed and ct. will set for new trial dates. Ct. allows Atty Klauser to withdraw. Bail conditions continue.
